definitions: regard or treat with contempt and strong disapproval
refuse or reject something with contempt and arrogance
examples: She disdained his attempts to apologize for his behavior
The aristocrats disdained the newly wealthy merchants completely
He disdained their offer of help despite needing assistance
The proud general disdained to negotiate with the rebels

definitions: get off or out of a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle
examples: Passengers slowly disembarked from the cruise ship at dawn
We disembarked the plane after the long international flight

definitions: separate or release something from something else it is attached to
withdraw from participation in an activity or emotional involvement
examples: She carefully disengaged the gears before stopping the machine
The mechanic disengaged the clutch to check the transmission
He gradually disengaged from the toxic relationship over time
The company decided to disengage from unprofitable market segments

definitions: regard or treat with disapproval or dislike
examples: The committee disfavored proposals that exceeded the budget limit
Critics disfavor his unconventional approach to classical music

definitions: bring shame or discredit upon someone or something through dishonorable actions
examples: His criminal behavior disgraced the entire family name
The scandal completely disgraced the once-respected politician

definitions: change appearance to conceal one's identity or true nature
make something appear different from its true form or character
examples: The spy disguised himself as a janitor to enter unnoticed
She disguised her voice when making the anonymous phone call
They disguised their disappointment with forced smiles and applause
The company disguised its losses through creative accounting methods

definitions: cause someone to feel intense aversion or revulsion
examples: The sight of rotten food thoroughly disgusted everyone present
His cruel behavior toward animals disgusts me deeply

definitions: put food onto plates or serve it informally
share gossip or intimate information about someone
examples: She dished out generous portions to all the hungry guests
The cafeteria workers dished up lunch for hundreds of students
The celebrities dished about their romantic lives on television
She loves to dish the latest office gossip during breaks

definitions: bring shame or discredit to someone or something
fail to honor or fulfill an agreement or obligation
examples: His cowardly actions dishonored his military uniform and rank
The corrupt judge dishonored the entire legal profession
The bank dishonored the check due to insufficient funds
They dishonored their contract by failing to deliver on time

definitions: break up into small parts or fragments physically
lose cohesion or strength and gradually fall apart completely
examples: The ancient manuscript disintegrated when exposed to air
The meteor disintegrated as it entered the Earth's atmosphere
Their marriage slowly disintegrated over years of constant arguing
The political alliance disintegrated after the election defeat

definitions: feel distaste for or hostility toward someone or something
examples: She strongly dislikes people who constantly interrupt others
Many children dislike vegetables until they grow older

definitions: remove or force something out from its fixed or lodged position
examples: The dentist carefully dislodged the piece of food between teeth
Strong winds dislodged several roof tiles during the storm

definitions: take apart a machine or structure in an orderly way
gradually abolish or destroy a system or organization
examples: Workers carefully dismantled the old factory equipment for recycling
The crew dismantled the stage after the concert ended
The new government promised to dismantle corrupt bureaucratic systems
Reformers sought to dismantle discriminatory laws and policies

definitions: cause someone to feel concern, distress, or disappointment
examples: The poor test results dismayed both students and teachers
News of the factory closure dismayed the entire community

definitions: cut or tear the limbs from a body
divide up a territory or organization into parts
examples: The medieval punishment involved dismembering traitors in public squares
Forensic experts examined how the killer dismembered the victim
The treaty dismembered the empire into several smaller nations
Corporate raiders dismembered the company and sold its parts

definitions: order or allow someone to leave a place
reject something as not worthy of serious consideration
remove someone from employment or a position
examples: The teacher dismissed the class five minutes early today
The judge dismissed the jury after reaching the verdict
Scientists dismissed his theory as completely without scientific merit
She dismissed their concerns as unnecessary worrying
The company dismissed several employees due to budget cuts
The board dismissed the CEO after the financial scandal

definitions: get down from a horse, bicycle, or other mounted position
examples: The cavalry soldiers dismounted and continued fighting on foot
She carefully dismounted from her bicycle at the intersection

definitions: refuse to follow rules, commands, or someone in authority
examples: The rebellious teenager constantly disobeyed her parents' rules
Soldiers who disobey direct orders face severe military punishment

definitions: refuse to acknowledge or maintain any connection with someone
examples: His wealthy parents disowned him for marrying against their wishes
The political party disowned the candidate after the scandal

definitions: send someone or something to a destination for a purpose
kill a person or animal quickly and efficiently
examples: The company dispatched technicians to repair the network immediately
Emergency services dispatched ambulances to the accident scene
The hunter dispatched the wounded deer with a single shot
The assassin dispatched his target without making any noise

definitions: make a doubt, feeling, or belief disappear completely
examples: His clear explanation dispelled all doubts about the project
The morning sun dispelled the fog that covered the valley

definitions: distribute or provide something to a number of people
provide a service or information in an official capacity
examples: The pharmacy dispenses prescription medications to hundreds of patients
The machine automatically dispenses tickets when you insert coins
The judge dispensed justice fairly to all who appeared before her
The counselor dispensed advice to troubled teenagers

definitions: distribute or spread over a wide area
cause a group of people to separate and go in different directions
examples: Wind dispersed the dandelion seeds across the meadow
The company dispersed its investments to minimize financial risk
Police used tear gas to disperse the angry crowd
The students dispersed quickly when the fire alarm sounded

definitions: force something or someone to move from its usual place
take over the position, role, or place of something
examples: The earthquake displaced thousands of families from their homes
Rising water levels displaced coastal communities permanently
Digital cameras completely displaced traditional film photography
Automation gradually displaced many factory workers

definitions: put something in a prominent place so people can see it
clearly demonstrate a quality, emotion, or skill
examples: The museum displays ancient artifacts in temperature-controlled cases
Stores display their best products in the front windows
The young pianist displayed remarkable talent during the competition
She displayed great courage in facing her illness

definitions: throw away or get rid of something unwanted
arrange things or people in a particular position
make someone inclined to think or act in a particular way
examples: Please dispose of your trash in the designated bins
The company must dispose of hazardous waste properly
The general disposed his troops strategically around the fortress
She disposed the flowers artistically in the vase
His friendly manner disposed us to trust him immediately
Recent events disposed her toward accepting the offer

definitions: prove that something is false or incorrect through evidence
examples: Scientists disproved the theory with new experimental data
The investigation disproved all allegations against the suspect

definitions: argue about something or engage in disagreement
question whether something is true, valid, or justified
examples: The neighbors disputed over the property boundary for years
Labor unions disputed with management about wage increases
Historians dispute the accuracy of these ancient records
No one can dispute her remarkable achievements

definitions: declare someone ineligible for something because of an offense or infringement
examples: The referee disqualified the runner for a false start
His criminal record disqualified him from government service

definitions: pay no attention to something or treat it as unimportant
examples: He completely disregarded the warning signs about the storm
The company disregarded safety regulations to save money

definitions: show a lack of respect or courtesy toward someone or something
examples: The students disrespected their teacher by talking during class
He never disrespects his elders despite their disagreements

definitions: interrupt an event, activity, or process by causing disturbance or problems
examples: The power outage disrupted business operations for several hours
Protesters disrupted the meeting by shouting slogans repeatedly

definitions: speak to or about someone in a disrespectful way
examples: The rapper dissed his rivals in his latest song
She felt hurt when her friends dissed her outfit

definitions: cut up a body or plant to study its internal parts
analyze something in minute detail to understand it better
examples: Biology students dissected frogs to learn about anatomy
The surgeon carefully dissected the tissue to remove the tumor
Critics dissected every scene of the controversial film
The committee dissected the proposal before making their decision

definitions: spread information, knowledge, or ideas widely to many people
examples: The organization disseminates health information through social media
Universities disseminate research findings through academic journals

definitions: hold or express opinions that differ from those officially or commonly held
examples: Several board members dissented from the majority decision
Citizens have the right to dissent peacefully from government policies

definitions: cause something to disperse, scatter, or disappear
waste money, energy, or resources in a foolish way
examples: The morning mist gradually dissipated as the sun rose
The crowd's anger dissipated after the announcement
He dissipated his inheritance on gambling and luxury cars
She dissipated her energy on too many different projects

definitions: disconnect or separate oneself from a person, group, or organization
examples: The company dissociated itself from the controversial statements
She dissociated from her former business partners after the scandal

definitions: become incorporated into a liquid to form a solution
formally end or dismiss an official body or agreement
gradually disappear or cause to disappear
examples: Sugar dissolves quickly in hot water
The tablet dissolved completely in the glass of water
Parliament was dissolved before the general election
They decided to dissolve their business partnership
Her anger dissolved when she saw his sincere apology
The crowd slowly dissolved as night fell

definitions: persuade someone not to take a particular course of action
examples: Her parents tried to dissuade her from dropping out of college
Nothing could dissuade him from pursuing his dangerous dream

definitions: make or maintain a space or separation between oneself and someone or something
examples: She gradually distanced herself from her toxic friends
The politician distanced himself from the controversial policy

definitions: purify a liquid by heating it until it becomes gas then cooling
extract the essential meaning or most important aspects of something
examples: The company distills whiskey using traditional copper stills
They distill water to remove all impurities
The professor distilled complex theories into simple principles
She distilled years of research into a concise report

definitions: recognize or treat someone or something as different
make oneself worthy of respect through exceptional performance or qualities
examples: She could easily distinguish between authentic and fake paintings
Color-blind people cannot distinguish certain colors from each other
He distinguished himself in battle through exceptional bravery
She distinguished herself as the top student in her class

definitions: pull or twist out of normal shape
give a misleading or false account or impression
examples: The funhouse mirror distorted their reflections into amusing shapes
Heat distorted the plastic container beyond recognition
The media distorted his words to create controversy
Personal bias can distort our perception of reality

definitions: prevent someone from concentrating on something by drawing their attention elsewhere
examples: Loud music distracts students from studying effectively
The magician distracted the audience while performing the trick

definitions: give shares of something to several people or places
spread something throughout an area or over a range
examples: Volunteers distribute food to homeless people every weekend
The company distributes its products through retail stores nationwide
Weight should be distributed evenly across the bridge structure
The population is distributed unevenly throughout the country

definitions: regard someone or something as untrustworthy or have no confidence in them
examples: Many people distrust politicians who make unrealistic promises
She learned to distrust her own judgment after several mistakes

definitions: interrupt the sleep, relaxation, or normal state of someone
make someone feel anxious, worried, or upset
examples: Please don't disturb me while I'm working on this report
The loud party disturbed all the neighbors until midnight
The violent images in the documentary deeply disturbed viewers
His strange behavior disturbed everyone at the meeting

definitions: get rid of or abandon someone or something abruptly
make an emergency landing of an aircraft on water
examples: He ditched his old friends when he became famous
She decided to ditch the party and go home early
The pilot successfully ditched the plane in the Hudson River
They had to ditch the helicopter in the ocean

definitions: say that the same thing applies again or express agreement
examples: When asked for her opinion, she simply said she dittoed everything
I ditto what she said about the new policy changes
